title: Royal Family : Prince Harry response to claims he trying to split King and William | Royal | News

Royal Family: Prince Harry's response to claims he's trying to split King and William
The Duke of Sussex reunited with his father earlier this month.
Prince Harry reunited with his father, King Charles, earlier this month at Clarence House, marking the first time the father and son had seen each other since February 2024. While their relationship is believed to have been rocky over recent years, the meeting—which lasted just shy of an hour—has been seen as a positive step in the right direction, giving Harry the reconciliation he has publicly expressed a desire for.
However, while the meeting was believed to have gone well, the Duke of Sussex, 41, has faced various criticisms since, including claims his meeting with his father was an attempt to disrupt the relationship between the King, 76, and his older son Prince William, 43. It is believed Harry and William have not been on talking terms for some time.
Prince Harry’s spokesman has now responded to such claims. They said: “Categorically not. Harry is not trying to drive a wedge between the Prince of Wales and the King.”
The statement comes as William and the King have just enjoyed a few days together at Balmoral Castle, something they have done for the last few years as King and heir.

King Charles signals Duke and Duchess of York are 'no longer welcome' at family Christmas
King Charles has signalled the Duke and Duchess of York are no longer welcome at the Royal Family’s Christmas. The decision comes as the pair's links to Jeffrey Epstein continue to cast a shadow over the Monarchy, reports The Times.
A source close to Charles told the Times: “You can’t sack someone from being your brother.
“But this year, if the duke and duchess were both to be as honourable [as last year], it would be very much for the best and the family would not be disappointed, not least to avoid the King having to make any more difficult decisions.”
The Yorks spent last Christmas together at the Royal Lodge but it is not thought that they were joined by their daughters Princesses Beatrice and Eugenie.
Meghan Markle 'alienating' the public by continuing to do one thing
Experts claim Meghan Markle is losing sight of her relatability factor after dripping in gold and diamonds at a Kevin Costner charity event in the United States. For years, the Duchess of Sussex has championed herself as approachable and down to earth, coming from a humble background, but experts are now questioning her tactics.
Ryan McCormick, Managing Partner at Goldman McCormick PR, told the Daily Mail, Meghan has to be "fully committed" to connect to everyday people.
He explained: "Wearing that kind of expensive jewelry communicates, 'I am in the upper class'. So we have two conflicting messages here, and that's one of the reasons why it could be challenging for some members of the public to emotionally connect with her."
Meghan Markle leaves royal fans speechless after Prince Archie comment
Meghan Markle confused royal fans during one of her recent appearances after she made a comment about Prince Archie. Prince Harry and the Duchess of Sussex appeared on a new special programme about Disneyland’s 70th anniversary, which aired last Sunday.
Meghan left fans stunned when she revealed in the show that six-year-old Archie asked when his own "birthday is".
The Duchess said: "For us to be able to have our own childhood memories and then watch that play out through our daughter's birthday."
She added: "So Archie asked, when is MY birthday?"
Sarah Ferguson set to face new royal drama - and it's got nothing to do with Epstein
Sarah Ferguson is set to face a fresh headache this year, even after her latest ordeal regarding her links to convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein. Sarah, Duchess of York has dominated news headlines around the world this week following the disclosure of an email she sent to the paedophile financier in which she described him as a "supreme friend".
Amid the backlash, several charities severed ties with Fergie, as she is affectionately known, after it emerged that she had apologised to the sex offender in April 2011 after publicly disowning him in an interview. Now, the Duchess is bracing for a fresh royal drama to drop as a new TV series focusing on the life of her former aide, who killed her partner, will be released.
Meghan Markle offered her own show on Magic FM radio
Meghan Markle has been offered her own show on the UK radio station, MagicFM. The generous offer comes after she revealed the radio station was "one of the things I miss most about the UK" during season two of With Love, Meghan.
The revelation about Meghan's favourite UK radio station came during episode three of 'With Love, Meghan, featuring Tan France.In the episode, titled 'Easy As Pie', the two cook a variety of dishes and chat about Meghan's love life.
The Queer Eye star is originally from Doncaster, which led her to admit that she missed UK radio stations the most about life in the country.
Prince William reveals one subject Prince George, Charlotte and Louis talk about 'a lot'
Prince William and Princess Kate stepped out for a moving day in Southport on Tuesday as the community continues to remember the three young girls who were killed in a dance class in the town last year. On Tuesday, the Prince and Princess of Wales, both 43, carried out a number of engagements in the area, which included visiting the schools attended by the three victims, Bebe King, six, Alice da Silva Aguiar, nine, and Elsie Dot Stancombe, seven.
While William and Kate keep their own children, Prince George, Princess Charlotte, and Prince Louis, as private as possible, the future King did speak about one subject his children talk about "a lot.”
Fans call on royal couple to become working royals and boost support for monarchy
Royal fans have taken to social media this week, calling for two members of the Royal Family to become working royals. Although loved members of the family, Zara and Mike Tindall have no royal titles, which means they carry out no official work for the monarchy.
Instead, Princess Anne’s daughter, 44, and Mike, 46, have their own careers, and only step out on the royal stage for big events, with Christmas being one of them. While the royal couple seem more than happy with this arrangement, which gives them the privacy to live a more ordinary life, royal fans have taken to X to express just how much they wish Zara and Mike would become working royals.
King finally breaks silence on controversial royal Netflix show
King Harald of Norway has spoken to media following the release of his daughter, Princess Märtha Louise's controversial Netflix documentary Rebel Royals: An Unlikely Love Story. The 100-minute-long show shows behind-the-scenes footage of her wedding to American shaman, Durek Verrett.
The show even prompted a response from the Norwegian palace about her commercial activities since stepping back from royal duties in 2022. The statement read, in part: "The Royal House wants a clearer distinction between the activities of Princess Märtha Louise and Durek Verrett and the Royal House. This will be the topic of the conversations we will have in the future."
Prince Harry's bombshell claims questioned: 'It doesn't add up'
Prince Harry's bombshell claims about his life within the Royal Family were dismissed by a former royal adviser, who claimed his own memories are "very different." The Duke of Sussex's explosive memoir, Spare, was released in January 2023, sending shockwaves around the world.
Now, Grant Harrold, who worked for the King for seven years when he was still the Prince of Wales, has spoken about his reaction to Harry's book after his own memoir, The Royal Butler: My Remarkable Life in Royal Service, was released in August.
He told Fox News: "I’ve openly talked about this because... his memories and mine are very different. You think we [were] in two different households because I talked about this happy family... with his stepmother and everything. He’s saying he didn’t. I never witnessed that."
Inside Prince Harry's 53-minute meeting with King Charles - and why Duke left 'surprised'
Prince Harry was reunited with King Charles during his recent trip to the UK. The 41-year-old touched down on home soil for four days earlier this month to conduct a host of charitable engagements.
Having travelled on his own, Harry reportedly gave King Charles a framed photograph of himself pictured with Meghan, Archie and Lilibet to mark their reunion.
Sources close to the Duke of Sussex claim that he is happy with his life in the US and only wants to reconcile with his family - and has no plans to return as a working royal.
Prince Harry issues shock statement blasting those 'sabotaging reconciliation' with father
Prince Harry has issued a shock new statement hitting back at claims about his recent meeting with King Charles III.
The 41-year-old met his father at Clarence House in London on September 10, in their first face to face meeting since February 2024. In the strongly worded Prince Harry described claims that he was surprised his recent reunion with the King was "distinctly formal" as "categorically false".
A spokesperson for the Duke of Sussex hit back today, saying: "Recent reporting of The Duke's view of the tone of the meeting, is categorically false.
Prince William's relatable admission about life with George, Charlotte and Louis
Prince William may be a future King, but behind-closed-doors his most important role is being a dad to Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis.
From doing the school run to watching sports games, the first-in-line to the throne is a very hands-on parent, as is his wife Princess Kate. Although William tends to not disclose too much about his private life, in his upcoming TV appearance, the future King makes a very relatable admission about what being a dad is really like.
In a trailer for the upcoming episode “Living the Royal Life in the UK,” which is part of actor Eugene Levy’s Apple TV+ series The Reluctant Traveler, William can be seen giving the Hollywood star a tour of Windsor Castle.
As they enjoyed a walk around the castle grounds, the actor asked William what he likes to do in his downtime.
Prince William replies: “Sleep. When you have three small children, sleep is an important part of my life.”
These £32 pearl earrings are so similar to Princess Kate's
If you fancy channeling your inner Princess of Wales but do not have the budget to do so then fear not as we’ve found a £32 pair of pearl earrings that rivals her designer look.
The Princess of Wales stepped out in Southport on Tuesday wearing her Kiki McDonough hoops styled with Annoushka pearl drops - a pairing she has worn on repeat since 2012.
Shoppers can now mirror Kate’s look for less with a high street alternative priced at just £32, bringing the same polished finish at a fraction of the cost.
These Orelia earrings echo Princess Kate’s beloved pearl drop style, but with a modern high street twist. With a brass base plated in 18k gold, the hoops are set with sparkling stones and finished with elegant freshwater pearls that give them the same timeless charm as Kate’s Annoushka pair. They’re also available in a chic silver option too.
Princess Kate’s secret tribute to Prince William after ‘difficult’ time
At the late Duchess of Kent’s funeral last week, the Princess of Wales offered a deeply personal tribute to Prince William through the rings she wore.
On her left hand, she stacked five bands on her engagement finger - each one charting a different chapter in her and Prince William’s journey together.
Collectively, each individual ring tells a story of young love, marriage, motherhood, duty, and endurance through adversity.
More recently, she has been seen wearing a second eternity band - a sapphire and diamond design given by William last year after she completed chemotherapy.
This new ring is believed to symbolise renewal, resilience, and the strength they found together during her health battle. Perhaps the most touching detail of all is the fifth ring - her pearl and garnet promise ring from her university days.

Prince William's favourite dessert revealed - and it's an absolute classic
Prince William may be the future King, but when it comes to desserts, he is just like the rest of us as his favourite treat is one that many of us love. The Prince of Wales' culinary preferences have been shared many times over the years by royal aides, his family and himself.
Recently, he revealed his brownie preferences, saying that his favourite is a chocolate brownie without nuts. And it seems chocolate is a common theme when it comes to desserts for the heir to the throne.
Meghan Markle shares new glimpse of Montecito home with sweet family member
Meghan Markle has given fans a new glimpse inside her Montecito home after uploading a video to her Instagram story. The Duchess of Sussex, 44, took to her Instagram account yesterday with a video of a flower arrangement in a vase, which had her brand As Ever's logo on.
The vase, which was placed on a black side table, was positioned in a corner of one of the many rooms in Meghan and Prince Harry’s Montecito mansion. As Meghan moved the camera to capture all of the bouquet, a nice cosy armchair could be seen beside the table, with their rescue beagle Mia sleeping on it.
One job Prince George will have to complete 'whether he likes it or not'
Prince George will likely have to undergo military training "whether he likes it or not", an expert has claimed. The 12-year-old, who will enter his teenage years next July, has now begun his final year at Lambrook School in Berkshire.
Although George's future is set to see him become monarch, his immediate path after his current school is unclear. Asked whether a royal not going into higher education is frowned upon, former royal butler Grant Harrold has said the young royal may choose not go to university - but added that there is one thing that George will likely be required to learn.
Sarah Ferguson 'devastated' about one thing following latest Epstein scandal
The Duchess of York is reportedly “devastated” this week after being involved in a new scandal. Last weekend, it was publicly revealed that Sarah Ferguson, 65, had sent an email to the late convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein in 2011 after he had been released from prison for child sex offences.
In the email, Prince Andrew’s ex-wife referred to Epstein as a “supreme friend” and apologised for having disowned him in an interview. A spokesperson for the duchess has claimed the email was only sent as Sarah feared being sued by Epstein for defamation.
While this may be the case, the scandal has turned into a PR nightmare for the duchess, who has been dropped as patron from a number of charities, including The Teenage Cancer Trust.
A friend of the duchess has said this is one thing that has “devastated” her about the revelation of the email.
Buckingham Palace shares major update on King Charles and Queen Camilla
Buckingham Palace has confirmed that King Charles and Queen Camilla will carry out a state visit to the Holy See to meet Pope Leo XIV.
The tour, which will take place in late October, will coincide with celebrations for the 2025 Papal Jubilee – a hugely symbolic time for the Catholic Church – and also commemorate the special relationship between the Church of England and the Catholic Church, reflecting this year’s Jubilee theme, Pilgrims of Hope.
Prince Andrew ‘had massages paid for by Epstein’ revealed in bombshell new files
Prince Andrew has come under fire against this week as new files reveal more about his past friendship with convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein. The Duke of York, 65, was friends with Epstein for many years, however claimed that he ended this friendship once becoming aware of his crimes.
Prince Andrew has always denied any wrongdoing, including accusations of sexual assault by Epstein victim Virginia Giuffre. However, new files have now put Andrew, 65, in the spotlight once more.
This is because these documents, released by Democrats sitting on the House Oversight Committee in the US, show that Andrew enjoyed luxury travel on Epstein’s private jet and had massages paid for by the late convicted paedophile.
Prince Harry's gift to King Charles confirmed but it's nothing to do with Meghan
Prince Harry did give a gift of a photograph to his father King Charles when they met just weeks ago, however it did not contain a picture of himself or Meghan Markle as previous reports suggested. It has been widely reported this week that the Duke of Sussex, 41, gave his father, 76, a photograph of Harry and Meghan, with their children Prince Archie and Princess Lilibet.
However, a spokesperson for Prince Harry, who quit royal life in 2020, has now said this is untrue. Instead, it is believed the prince handed the King a framed photograph that did not include himself or his wife, and most likely just included the monarch’s grandchildren.
Prince William's relatable admission about life with George, Charlotte and Louis
Prince William may be a future King, but behind-closed-doors his most important role is being a dad to Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis. While The Prince of Wales, 43, has plenty of royal responsibilities, he has made it clear his children are always among his top priorities, something he has shown through his actions.
From doing the school run to watching sports games, the first-in-line to the throne is a very hands-on parent, as is his wife Princess Kate. Like most parents, this means William sees the highs and lows of parenting on a daily basis, which can be tiring. Although William tends to not disclose too much about his private life, in his upcoming TV appearance, the future King makes a very relatable admission about what being a dad to three children aged 12, 10 and seven, is really like.
Surprising gift Prince Harry gave King Charles during 'formal' reunion
Prince Harry and King Charles made a big step towards healing their royal rift earlier this month after a meeting at Clarence House.
The Duke of Sussex, who quit royal life in 2020, was invited to his father’s home for a private tea just weeks ago during his four-day UK trip. While the meeting was just shy of an hour long, Harry seemed to want to make the most of the chance to patch things up with his father, who he claimed in May wouldn’t speak to him, which means the duke did not turn up empty-handed.
Princess Kate shares heartfelt message with never-before-seen photo
Princess Kate has issued a heartfelt statement today alongside a new photograph ahead of the Women's Rugby World Cup Final. The Princess of Wales, as patron of the Rugby Football Union, is a great supporter of the England rugby team.
In a new statement today, she said: "Good luck England! Wishing the very best of luck to the Red Roses in their Women’s Rugby World Cup Final at Twickenham today. We’re so proud of you! C."

Princess Beatrice's duties at charity come to end days after Sarah Ferguson scandal
Princess Beatrice's current duties at a charity Prince Philip loved have come to an end. The princess, 37, is no longer carrying out the duties she had at the Outward Bound Trust - a charity which helps young people to grow through real adventure.
Prince Andrew's eldest daughter has played a role at the charity for six years, when she became a trustee. Her role with the charity came after Prince Andrew - who was also once on the board of trustees - had to step down as patron of the charity following his 2019 Newsnight interview with Emily Maitlis about his past friendship with convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein.
King Charles issues heartfelt statement ahead of huge event today
King Charles has issued a new statement today ahead of the Women's Rugby World Cup Final later. The monarch, 76, has sent "warmest good wishes" to both the England Red Roses and Canada Women's Rugby Team as they are set to play against each other.
In a statement on Saturday morning, the King said: "My wife and I send our warmest good wishes to both the England Red Roses and Canada Women's Rugby Team as you prepare for your World Cup Final. What a remarkable achievement for both teams to have reached this pinnacle of the sport."
A message from His Majesty The King to @RedRosesRugby and Women's @RugbyCanada Team following today\u2019s #RWC2025 final. pic.twitter.com/1pQ7IT7ZZy
\u2014 The Royal Family (@RoyalFamily) September 27, 2025
Buckingham Palace fighting to 'keep up' with Princess Anne as royal asks for more help
A Royal expert has suggested that Buckingham Palace staff are finding it difficult to match Princess Anne's pace, as she undertakes nearly 500 official duties annually.
Discussing the Princess Royal, commentator Richard Eden disclosed that merely two years after recruiting a programme manager, the Palace is now seeking another, offering an increased salary this time.
Royal source sets record straight on King Charles and Prince William rift rumours
Royal insiders have set the record straight on a rumoured rift between King Charles and his eldest son, Prince William. Various reports have cited sources claiming there is a wedge between the Prince of Wales and the monarch, shortly after the King's meeting with Prince Harry during his four-day visit to the UK.
Meanwhile, renowned royal biographer Tina Brown said that the King is "less irritated" by Harry than William, as the heir's "parenting dedication" seems like a "tacit criticism of the King’s own paternal deficiencies". However, royal sources close to both the King and William have dismissed those claims and said their relationship is stronger than ever.
Prince William says 'life is sent to test us' in frank admission to Hollywood star
Prince William has said "life is sent to test us" as he opened up to the Hollywood actor, Eugene Levy, on his travel show, The Relucant Traveler in an episode that comes out on October 3 on Apple TV+. The Prince of Wales and the Schitts Creek star were filmed walking around Windsor and sitting down to talk candidly in a local pub.
In a rare interview, William is seen opening up about the difficulties of the past 19 months, particularly with his father and wife diagnosed with cancer within weeks of one another. The royal said: "I'd say 2024 was the hardest year I've ever had. You know, life is sent to test us as well, and being able to overcome that is what makes us who we are."
Prince Harry's ‘desperate pivot' will not mend royal rift
Prince Harry's recent charity endeavours and attempts at reconciliation with the Royal Family have been dismissed as a "desperate pivot born of necessity”. Speaking on Fox News on Thursday, royal commentator Hilary Fordwich claimed the Duke of Sussex had inflicted "irreparable wounds" on the monarchy.
She further criticised his sharing of schedules with Buckingham Palace as a "transparent PR manoeuvre" laced with ulterior motives. Palace insiders have rejected Harry's rumoured push for a partial royal return as a "tone-deaf delusion.” Ms Fordwich said that his "victim narrative" remains a "toxic liability" that could further embroil the royals in scandal. The Palace, she added, would be "foolish" to consider any reconciliation with the Duke of Sussex.
Exciting outing announced for Princess Kate - and it's just days away
Princess Kate will step out for a special visit to Royal Air Force Coningsby next Thursday (October 2). This will mark the first time that the 43-year-old has paid a visit since she became Royal Honorary Air Commodore in 2023.
The visit will give her an opportunity to have a firsthand introduction to RAF Coningsby and the work they do as part of the Royal Air Force. Following her arrival, Kate will receive an overview of the work of RAF Coningsby on recent operations, including overseas operations to Poland in support of NATO.
